member.summary: Documents are converted to shades of Gray

member.summary: Documents are scanned by the OCR software in full color

member.name: T:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters
member.summary: Allows you to define global defaults used by the test engine

member.name: M:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.#ctor
member.summary: Allows you to define global defaults used by the test engine

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.ScreenshotNaming
member.summary:
Defines the naming template for screenshots. Available variables are:
%TCNAME%: Testcase name %COND%: Contains the value of if it is the precondition step. Is empty otherwise %TCSTEP%: Step number %SHOTNR%: Screenshot run number of current step %NAME%: Name of the screenshot

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.ScreenshotPassedStepName
member.summary: Indicator string used to name automatically generated screenshots for passed steps (Default: "PASSED")

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.ScreenshotFailedStepName
member.summary: Indicator string used to name automatically generated screenshots for failed steps (Default: "FAILED")

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.ScreenshotAbortedStepName
member.summary: Indicator string used to name automatically generated screenshots for aborted steps (Default: "ABORTED")

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.ScreenshotExecutionAbortedName
member.summary: Indicator string used to name automatically generated screenshots for steps that completely aborted the test case execution (Default: "ExecutionAborted")

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.PreconditionStepName
member.summary: Used to name the precondition step. Mainly used for automatic screenshot generation

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.ResultLogFailedTemplate
member.summary:
Indicator string used to start an entry in the results log for failed steps (Default: "FAILED: %CONTENT%+Enviornment.NewLine") Available variables are:
%CONTENT%: Content of the test log entry

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.ResultLogPassedTemplate
member.summary:
Indicator string used to start an entry in the results log for passed steps (Default: "%CONTENT%+Enviornment.NewLine") Available variables are:
%CONTENT%: Content of the test log entry

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.ResultLogAbortedTemplate
member.summary:
Indicator string used to start an entry in the results log for aborted steps (Default: "ABORTED: %CONTENT%+Enviornment.NewLine") Available variables are:
%CONTENT%: Content of the test log entry

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.AutoNumberPattern
member.summary: Pattern used for screenshot number generation (Default: "000", numbers are padded with zeros to its left to have at least 3 digits)

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.ForceScreenRefreshAlways
member.summary: Requestes a remote full screen refresh of the subject under test for every action the access the remote screen

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.ForceScreenRefreshBeforeStep
member.summary: Requestes a remote full screen refresh of the subject under test before a step is started

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.ForceScreenRefreshAfterInteraction
member.summary: Requestes a remote full screen refresh of the subject under test if there was an interaction beforehand

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.ScreenRefreshWait
member.summary: Defines that the execution should wait in case a screen fresh is requested until a refresh remote screen was received by the test engine

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.ScreenRefreshWaitTimeout
member.summary: Defines the maximum amount of milliseconds the test engine should block the execution while waiting for a screen refresh

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.SearchDuration
member.summary: Defines how long an on-screen search should be continued while no result was found

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.SearchRetryWaitTimeInMs
member.summary: Defines how long the search should wait before a retry is started

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.ClipboardTimeOut
member.summary: Defines the amount of milliseconds the engine should wait for new clipboard content until it returns the previous content of the clipboard

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.UpdateCheckerRefreshTimeOut
member.summary: Defines the amount of millisonds the engine should wait before it checks for a new screen update (only used if you call RegisterForUpdateCheck())

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.UseImagePositionCache
member.summary: Enabled image position cache. If enabled the position of every image is cached once it was found. In subsequent searches the image is first look for at the last successfull coordinates if not found the image is looked for on the complete screen.

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.ImageDetectionPrecision
member.summary: Global precision used for image detection. 1 = perfect match, 0 = everything.

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.KeyDownDelay
member.summary: Amount of milliseconds the engine waits between the KeyDown and KeyUp event for a KeyPress

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.KeyNextDelay
member.summary: Amount of milliseconds the engine waits between typing characters

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.GeneralInteractionWaitTime
member.summary: Amount of milliseconds the engine waits between every high-level interaction before it continues

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.RapidInteractionWaitTime
member.summary: Amount of milliseconds the engine waits between every SUT interaction before it continues. This is the minimum amout of time. You should not need to change it.

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.MouseClickDelay
member.summary: Amount of milliseconds the engine waits between the MouseDown and MouseUp event for a MouseClick

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.MouseMoveOutOfScreen
member.summary: If enabled moves the mouse cursor out of screen before searching for an image or text

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.MouseMoveOutOffset
member.summary: Defines the delta by which the mouse should moved if the engine requested the move the mouse out of the screen (Default: Empty)

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.MouseClickApproachOffset
member.summary: Defines a delta from the target position of an interaction. The mouse move to this delta position is fast and from the delta position to the final position the move will be moved pixel by pixel.

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.DefaultOcrEngine
member.summary: Defines the default ocr engine used for text recognition

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.DefaultImageEngine
member.summary: Defines the default image detection engine used for image recognition

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.TextSearchLevel
member.summary: Defines the search level of the text recognition, e.g. what is recognized as a combination (Default: StringComparison)

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.TextDetectionAccuracy
member.summary: Defines the accurary of the found text with the following meaning (Default: 1.9) 0.0 perfect match, 0.1 one white space difference, 0.2 one character matched the second guess 0.3 one character matched the third guess 0.5 one related character difference, 0.6 one related character difference based on the second guess, 0.7 one related character difference based on the third guess, 0.8 one character group replaced 1.0 one unrelated character difference

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.TextDetectionLanguagesToUse
member.summary: Defines the set of languages used for recognizing text (sequence does not define priority)

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.GlobalEngineParameters.TextDetectionRelatedCharacters
member.summary: Allows to adjust the default related characters matrix for text recognition

member.name: F:Progile.ATE.Common.ZoneCharacterFilters.None
member.summary: No character filters.

member.name: F:Progile.ATE.Common.ZoneCharacterFilters.Digit
member.summary: Recognition of numerals only. e.g. "3" (Digit Three).

member.name: F:Progile.ATE.Common.ZoneCharacterFilters.Uppercase
member.summary: Recognition of uppercase letters only, including accented ones. e.g. "A" (Capital A).

member.name: F:Progile.ATE.Common.ZoneCharacterFilters.Lowercase
member.summary: Recognition of lowercase letters only including accented ones. e.g. "a" (Lowercase a).

member.name: F:Progile.ATE.Common.ZoneCharacterFilters.Alpha
member.summary: Upper and lowercase letters only. This is a combination of (Uppercase | Lowercase).

member.name: F:Progile.ATE.Common.ZoneCharacterFilters.Punctuation
member.summary: Recognition of punctuation signs only. e.g. "!" (Exclamation Mark).

member.name: F:Progile.ATE.Common.ZoneCharacterFilters.Miscellaneous
member.summary: Recognition of other miscellaneous characters only. e.g. "+" (Plus sign).

member.name: F:Progile.ATE.Common.ZoneCharacterFilters.All
member.summary: All characters. Since all elements are enabled, there is no filtering. This a combination of Digit (| Uppercase | Lowercase | Punctuation | Miscellaneous).

member.name: F:Progile.ATE.Common.ZoneCharacterFilters.Numbers
member.summary: Digits plus the "FilterPlus" characters This is a combination of (Digit | Plus).

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.LEADOcrEngineParameters.DetectInvertedTextRegions
member.summary: If true detects and removes inverted text regions to allow OCR to detect normal and inverted font colors in the same image

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.LEADOcrEngineParameters.EnableSpellChecking
member.summary: If true, enables LEAD OCR spell checking, otherwise false

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.LEADOcrEngineParameters.CharacterFilters
member.summary: Define a character filter to get better ocr engine results

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.LEADOcrEngineParameters.AdvancedSettings
member.summary: Advanced LEAD settings

member.name: F:Progile.ATE.Common.SearchLevel.None
member.summary: Default level, no search area defined

member.name: F:Progile.ATE.Common.SearchLevel.Words
member.summary: Search for every word in the search string on every detected line of text and return the result containing those words.

member.name: F:Progile.ATE.Common.SearchLevel.Line
member.summary: Search for every word in the search string on every detected line of text and return the result containing the whole detected line.

member.name: F:Progile.ATE.Common.SearchLevel.Paragraph
member.summary: Search for every word in the search string in every detected paragraph of text and return the result containing the whole detected paragraph.

member.name: F:Progile.ATE.Common.SearchLevel.StringComparison
member.summary: Searches for the search string character by character without interpreting word boundaries etc

member.name: F:Progile.ATE.Common.SearchLevel.MultiLines
member.summary: Search for every word in the search string anywhere in the detected text and return the result containing the whole detected text.

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrPreprocessingParameters.UseSharpnessModification
member.summary: If true apply the sharpness modification on the image before the ocr detection, otherwise false.

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrPreprocessingParameters.SharpnessValue
member.summary: The amount to change the sharpness. Valid values range from -1000 to +1000. Negative sharpness values decrease the sharpness of the image. Specify -1000 for minimum sharpness. Positive sharpness values increase the sharpness. Specify +1000 for maximum sharpness.

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrPreprocessingParameters.UseBinarizeModification
member.summary: If true apply the binarize modification on the image before the ocr detection, otherwise false. If no BinarizeThreashold is defined (or set to -1) this function applies binary segmentation to a bitmap automatically. If a BinarizeThreshold is defined this function applies binary segmentation to an image by converting everything darker than the threshold to black and everything lighter to white.

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrPreprocessingParameters.BinarizeThreshold
member.summary: Defines the binarize threshold. Possible values are between 0 and 255. Set it to -1 to enable automatic binary segmentation.

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrPreprocessingParameters.UseGrayScaleModification
member.summary: If true apply the gray scale modification on the image before the ocr detection, otherwise false. Converts a color image to an 8-bit gray scale image.

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrPreprocessingParameters.UseColorReplaceModification
member.summary: If true, replaces the specified color with a defined new color on the screen image before the ocr detection.

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrPreprocessingParameters.ColorReplaceColorToReplace
member.summary: The color which should be replaced

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrPreprocessingParameters.ColorReplacementRangeOfColorsToReplace
member.summary: The color range around the color which should be replaced. Value has to be between 0 to 1.

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrPreprocessingParameters.ColorReplacementNewColor
member.summary: The new color which will be inserted

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrPreprocessingParameters.UseInvertModification
member.summary: If true inverts the colors of the screen image before the ocr detection. Inverts the colors in the specified image, giving it the appearance of a photographic negative.

member.name: M:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrEngineRelatedCharacters.ClearRelatedChars
member.summary: Clear all related chars

member.name: M:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrEngineRelatedCharacters.NewRelation(System.Char[])
member.summary: Create a new related chars

member.name: M:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrEngineRelatedCharacters.AddToRelation(System.Char[])
member.summary: Add a new char to an already existing related chars

member.name: M:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrEngineRelatedCharacters.ClearRelatedCharGroups
member.summary: Clear all related chars groups

member.name: M:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrEngineRelatedCharacters.NewRelation(System.String[])
member.summary: Add new relation. Is there for backwards compatibility reasons.

member.name: M:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrEngineRelatedCharacters.AddToRelation(System.String[])
member.summary: Adds a new string group relation

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrEngineParameters.TestImagePath
member.summary: The local directory to store the image used for OCR

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrEngineParameters.OcrTextColorTestImage
member.summary: The color in which the detected text is printed on the debug image

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrEngineParameters.OcrBoundaryColorTestImage
member.summary: The color in which the detected characters are outlined on the debug image

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrEngineParameters.Preprocessing
member.summary: Allows to enable different image modifications that are applied to the screen image before the ocr engine searches the text

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrEngineParameters.OcrEngine
member.summary: Defines which ocr engine should be used

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrEngineParameters.SearchLevel
member.summary: Defines in which area should be searched

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrEngineParameters.WordCountHasToMatch
member.summary: If true the word count from the search text and the detected text have to match, otherwise false.

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrEngineParameters.PrioritizePartialPerfectMatch
member.summary: If true strings which contain the exact search text are prioritized, otherwise false. e.g. If the search text is "Hallo" and one text is "Hallx" and and an other is "Hallo123456789" the second text will be return

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrEngineParameters.Accuracy
member.summary: Defines the maximal accuracy the detected text can deviate from the search text. 0 = perfect match 0.1 = one whitespace difference 0.2 = one 2nd guess match 0.3 = one 3th guess match 0.5 = one related char match 0.6 = one related char 2nd guess match 0.7 = one related char 3th guess match 0.8 = one related char group match 1 = one char difference

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrEngineParameters.IgnoreCapitalization
member.summary: If true capitalization will be ignored, otherwise false.

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrEngineParameters.EngineDependentParameters
member.summary: Engine dependent parameters.

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrEngineParameters.IgnoreSpecialCharacters
member.summary: If true all special characters will be ignored, otherwise false.

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrEngineParameters.TreatSpecialCharactersAsSeparateWord
member.summary: If true every special character will be treated as separate word. e.g. the text "Hallo+World" will be modified to "Hallo + World"

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrEngineParameters.EnableOverallAccuracy
member.summary: If true the accuracy for all words get sum up, otherwise just the worst accuracy from one word will be return.

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrEngineParameters.EnableStartStringAnchor
member.summary: If true it will be checked if the search string starts on a word boundary. If this is not the case it will lead to a higher accuracy.

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrEngineParameters.EnableEndStringAnchor
member.summary: If true it will be checked if the search string ends on a word boundary. If this is not the case it will lead to a higher accuracy.

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrEngineParameters.LanguagesToUse
member.summary: Defines the language the ocr engine will using

member.name: P:Progile.ATE.Common.OcrEngineParameters.SearchPattern
member.summary: The search pattern allows you to prioritize specific character or character groups. If you do not start with ^ it will look for the specific character. If you start with ^ you have the options 0 = Digits, A/a = Char, X/x = Digit or Char, . = Punctuation, S = Separator, C = Control [Line End] character. You can use + and * modifiers for multiple occurrences. You can use ! modifiers to active case sensitivity. e.g. a^!+A^+0^aNumber
